techmeme.title: Intel shares fall 26% to close at $21.48 in their biggest drop since 1974, after the company reported a big earnings miss; Intel's market cap is now below $100B (CNBC)
Trump says Zuckerberg called him after the assassination attempt and told Trump he wouldn't endorse a Democrat because he "respected" Trump's reaction that day (Gaby Del Valle/The Verge)
Crypto lender Genesis and related companies complete their bankruptcy restructuring and begin distributing ~$4B in digital assets and cash to creditors (Olga Kharif/Bloomberg)
Sources: Revolut has told staff it is launching a sale of up to $500M worth of existing shares at a $45B valuation; former employees are ineligible (Akila Quinio/Financial Times)
Character.AI told staff that investors will be bought out at a valuation of ~2.5x its $1B 2023 valuation, and it plans to adopt open-source models for products (The Information)
